properties.description: Schema containing all the abstract and core type definitions comprising the MAP Core Dance Schema.
Abstract holon type for descriptors of executable dances, linking to a specific request and response holon type.
Abstract holon type for response objects returned from dances. Includes response body and status code.
Abstract holon type for structured response bodies returned from dances.
Concrete binding of a DanceType for a specific TypeDescriptor, with executable details (engine, module, entrypoint, ABI, version/compat).
Declares that a HolonType affords (supports) a DanceType (i.e., the verb is valid for instances of the type).
Inverse of Affords, from DanceType to HolonType.
Binds a TypeDescriptor to a specific DanceImplementation that can be dispatched.
Inverse of ImplementsDance, from DanceImplementation to TypeDescriptor.
Pins a DanceImplementation to exactly one DanceType interface it satisfies.
Inverse of ForDance, from DanceType to DanceImplementation.
Links a DanceType to the HolonType used as its request body.
Inverse of Request, from HolonType to DanceType.
Links a DanceType to the DanceResponseType used to structure its response.
Inverse of Response, from DanceResponseType to DanceType.
Links a DanceResponseType to the ResponseBodyType that will serve as the structured response body.
Inverse of ResponseBody, from ResponseBodyType to DanceResponseType.
Unique string identifier for a DanceType descriptor, used in dispatch tables.
Human-readable explanation of what the dance does or when it should be invoked.
Machine-readable status code indicating the result of the dance.
Execution engine for the implementation (e.g., WasmWasi, Process, RustDylib, Builtin).
Content-address or locator of the executable module (e.g., hash/URL/capability address).
Function/export name to invoke inside the module.
Identifier of the stable smart contract ABI expected by the module/entrypoint.
Semantic version or content hash pin of the implementation.
Compatibility range or constraints (e.g., ABI or schema versions).
Human-readable summary of a dance outcome.
Standard set of status codes returned by dances, aligned with HTTP semantics.
200 — Request succeeded.
202 — Request accepted but not yet processed.
400 — The request was malformed or invalid.
401 — The requester is not authenticated.
403 — The requester lacks permission.
404 — The target resource was not found.
409 — Conflict with the current state of the resource.
422 — Semantic validation failed.
500 — Unexpected internal error.
501 — Functionality required to fulfill the request is not supported.
503 — The server is currently unable to handle the request (overload/maintenance).
Enum value type for execution engines used by DanceImplementations.
Execute a WASM module under WASI (preferred).
Spawn a separate OS process with protocol pipes.
Dynamically load a Rust dylib via FFI (platform-coupled).
Call a registered host builtin function.
Response body summarizing the result of a commit request.
Number of holons the commit operation attempted to save.
Enum value type for commit request outcomes (Complete, Incomplete).
All staged holons committed; no staged holons remain.
One or more staged holons could not be committed; some may remain in New or Changed state pending error resolution.
Overall status of the commit request (Complete or Incomplete).
Declared relationship from a CommitResponse to each holon successfully saved by this commit.
Inverse of SavedHolons. Links a holon to a CommitResponse that successfully saved it.
Declared relationship from a CommitResponse to each holon that was not saved due to validation or commit errors.
Inverse of AbandonedHolons.  Links a holon to a CommitResponse that did not successfully save it.
